intro: Strychnos mortehanii, commonly known as the African poisonwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody, egg-shaped fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are a source of strychnine and brucine—powerful alkaloids. Its toxic properties make it a notable species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
